channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: Obama Offers U.N. Forceful Case for Global ISIS Response
item.description: President Obama offered a blueprint for deeper American engagement in the Middle East, telling the General Assembly that a coalition was needed to confront the Islamic State, which understood only “the language of force.”
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Hong Kong’s Former No. 2 Official Says Beijing Paid Him $1.42 Million
item.description: Rafael Hui Si-yan, Hong Kong’s former chief secretary, testified that he received the money in late 2007 from a friend who said it was from “someone from Beijing” but refused to identify the donor.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN WONG
item.media:description: Rafael Hui Si-yan, Hong Kong's former chief secretary, arriving for his corruption trial at the High Court last May.

item.title: French Hostage in Algeria Is Beheaded in New Video
item.description: Hervé Gourdel, who was seized on Sunday by a group aligned with the Islamic State, was seen beheaded in a video circulated online on Wednesday.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By RUKMINI CALLIMACHI

item.title: United Nations General Assembly: Submit Your Questions on U.N. Efforts to Fight ISIS
item.description: Submit your questions for New York Times reporters on the threats militants pose and the possible U.N. action ahead of this afternoon’s Security Council meeting.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: United Nations General Assembly: Ban Ki-Moon Says U.N. ‘Must Answer the Call’ to Fight Climate Change, Ebola and Extremism
item.description: “People are crying out for protection from greed and inequality,” Ban Ki-Moon, the secretary general said Wednesday. “The United Nations must answer the call.”
item.dc:creator: By SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: Deborah Cavendish, Duchess With an Uncommon Touch, Dies at 94
item.description: The Dowager Duchess, the last of six eccentric Mitford sisters, was an author and businesswoman who helped turn her husband’s ancestral estate, Chatsworth, into a tourist attraction.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT D. McFADDEN
item.media:credit: Jonathan Player for The New York Times
item.media:description: Deborah Cavendish, the Duchess of Devonshire in the gardens of her home, Chatsworth, in 2003.

item.title: United Nations General Assembly: Obama, at U.N., Lays Out Forceful Blueprint to Fight Islamic Extremism
item.description: In a much anticipated speech at the United Nations General Assembly, President Obama said “I ask the world to join in this effort.”
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: United Nations General Assembly: A Safer, Cleaner United Nations Hall
item.description: The General Assembly building was the last in the United Nations complex to be fixed up, which means it is finally up to city code.
item.dc:creator: By SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:credit: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times
item.media:description: Among the upgrades to the United Nations General Assembly hall are new electronic country signs.

item.title: French Judge Puts Sarkozy Corruption Investigation on Hold
item.description: The inquiry was temporarily suspended while judges consider Mr. Sarkozy’s motion to dismiss the corruption and influence-peddling charges.
item.dc:creator: By MAÏA de la BAUME

item.title: The Cost for Arab Bank Is a Complex Calculation
item.description: Legal experts said many factors suggested that the institution, found liable for knowingly supporting terrorism, may be asked to pay a judgment near or exceeding $1 billion.
item.dc:creator: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD

item.title: 3 Islamic Militant Suspects Back in Custody in France After Botched Arrests
item.description: The three men turned themselves in to the French authorities after a mix-up that had allowed them to walk free.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: Abu Qatada Acquitted on 2nd Terrorism Charge
item.description: The militant Islamic cleric known as Abu Qatada walked free after he was cleared of plotting a terror attack against Israeli and Western tourists at a millennium celebration in Jordan in 2000.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By RANYA KADRI and ALAN COWELL
item.media:description: Abu Qatada, right, hugged his father as he was released from a Jordan prison after a court acquitted the militant Islamic cleric on terror charges.

item.title: Chinese President Sends Signal Against Political Change in Hong Kong
item.description: President Xi Jinping lends his authority to efforts to restrict democratic expansion during meeting with some of territory’s leading tycoons.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and ALAN WONG
item.media:description: Tung Chee-hwa, Hong Kong’s first chief executive after the 1997 handover, left, with President Xi Jinping in Beijing on Monday.

item.title: In China, Trial Begins for Former Official Accused of Taking Millions in Bribes
item.description: Liu Tienan, a former deputy chairman of the national economic planning commission, is the latest top official swept up in China’s anticorruption push.
item.dc:creator: By DAN LEVIN
item.media:description: A still from video footage showing Liu Tienan, 58, a former deputy chairman of the National Development and Reform Commission, in court on Wednesday.

item.title: Airstrikes Target ISIS in Syria Near Turkish Border
item.description: Militants from the Islamic State had besieged a number of Kurdish villages near the border, sending tens of thousands of refugees into Turkey.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: Refugees from Syria waited at the Turkish border near Sanliurfa, Turkey, on Wednesday. Turkey is wary that the fight against the Islamic State is empowering separatist Kurdish militants on both sides of the border.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Western Governments Criticize Uighur Scholar’s Punishment
item.description: Statements by the United States and the European Union expressed deep concern over the conviction and life sentence for Ilham Tohti on charges of separatism.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Ilham Tohti during his trial on separatism charges, as shown on Chinese state television.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Egypt’s Hunger Strikers
item.description: Desperation grows among political prisoners, but the regime continues to ignore their plight.
item.dc:creator: By MAYY EL SHEIKH

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Crete Finds Self in Union
item.description: Even a fiercely independent and rebellious people can feel the tug of belonging.
item.dc:creator: By NIKOS KONSTANDARAS

item.title: On a Shoestring, India Sends Orbiter to Mars
item.description: A spacecraft nicknamed MOM successfully reached Mars orbit Wednesday, making India the first nation to accomplish the feat on a maiden voyage.
item.dc:creator: By GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India, left, congratulated K. Radhakrishnan, head of the Indian Space Research Organization, on Wednesday in Bangalore after the Mars Orbiter successfully entered the red planet's orbit.

item.title: Lens Blog: Workers Unite at an Argentine Hotel
item.description: When Argentina’s financial crisis left workers at the Hotel Bauen unemployed, they took over the hotel and ran it themselves.
item.dc:creator: By JONATHAN GILBERT
item.media:description: An outside view of Hotel Bauen.

item.title: United Nations General Assembly: President Enrique Peña Nieto of Mexico to Address U.N. General Assembly
item.description: The Mexican president, still more popular abroad than he is at home, is expected to promote steps to modernize and remake Mexico’s economy and raise the standard of living when he addresses the General Assembly on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: By RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD
item.media:description: President Enrique Peña Nieto of Mexico.

item.title: Australian Police Say Terror Suspect Was Killed After Slashing Officers
item.description: The man wounded two members of a police counterterrorism task force, one of whom shot him, the authorities said.
item.dc:creator: By MICHELLE INNIS
item.media:description: The scene of the fatal shooting of an 18-year-old man at the Endeavour Hills Police Station in Melbourne on Wednesday.

item.title: China Sentences Uighur Scholar to Life
item.description: The punishment of Ilham Tohti, a professor widely considered to be a moderate voice among ethnic Uighurs, was among the harshest imposed on a dissident in years.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG
item.media:description: Ilham Tohti, an economics professor, in 2013. He was sentenced to life in prison on Tuesday after being convicted of separatism.

item.title: United Nations General Assembly: Could the U.N. Meet Outside of New York?
item.description: The General Assembly hall was built in New York in 1952, and this is where the annual high-level sessions have been held every year.
item.dc:creator: By SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: Obama Presses Chinese on Global Warming
item.description: President Obama, emboldened by his use of executive powers to fight climate change at home, challenged China to make the same effort to reduce greenhouse-gas emissions.
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER and CORAL DAVENPORT
item.media:description: Vice Premier Zhang Gaoli of China spoke at the United Nations Climate Summit on Tuesday in New York.
